definition: dispute or misunderstanding caused by gossip/to talk sb round
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
tongue
to argue needlessly/to waste time explaining
incessant complaining
to boast of one's quarrels to others (idiom)

sentences.english: You are wasting your breath; he won't change his mind.
sentences.chinese: 你在白费口舌，他不会改变主的。

sentences.english: Or put my tongue in durance for to die?
sentences.chinese: 或者有什么可以将我的口舌囚禁至死？

sentences.english: Bards will not spare breath upon your pitiful empire.
sentences.chinese: 吟游诗人将不会在你那可鄙的王朝上多费口舌。

sentences.english: You're wasting your breath. I won't change my mind.
sentences.chinese: 你不必多费口舌，我是不会改变主意的。

sentences.english: I've already made up my mind. There's no sense flogging a dead horse .
sentences.chinese: 我已经下了决心，不必再白费口舌了。

sentences.english: Asking him is wasting my breath.
Save your breath, the boss will never give you the day off.
sentences.chinese: 别白费口舌了，老板不会给你假的。

sentences.english: He won’t pay attention to anybody, you’re just wasting your breath.
sentences.chinese: 他对谁都不加理会，你不过是白费口舌。

sentences.english: A little inaccuracy sometimes saves tons of explanation.
sentences.chinese: 打个马虎眼有时可省却许多口舌来解释。

sentences.english: He won't listen to anybody. You're just wasting your breath.
sentences.chinese: 他谁的话都不听，你只是白费口舌。

sentences.english: It was mere waste of breath to argue with a person in so unreasonable a state of mind.
sentences.chinese: 和一个如此不可理喻的人争论纯粹是白费口舌。

sentences.english: Offering unnecessary care would, in fact, be faster.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，医生提供不必要的诊疗反而不用多费口舌。

sentences.english: Save your breath; you'll never change her mind.
sentences.chinese: 别费口舌了，你永远改变不了她的主意的。

sentences.english: Don't waste words on that fellow.
sentences.chinese: 不要同那家伙白费口舌。

sentences.english: Talk people tend to fall into a non-trivial quarrel in the long-winded.
sentences.chinese: 议论别人往往陷入鸡毛蒜皮的是非口舌中纠缠不清。

sentences.english: North Korea frequently lobs incendiary rhetoric across the border.
sentences.chinese: 朝鲜经常挑起南北双方之间的口舌之争。

definition: argument/words/lips and tongue
to show off/to flaunt/to carry out or succeed in a scheme/to indulge/to give free rein to
to argue needlessly/to waste time explaining
mouth and teeth/enunciation/to articulate/diction/age (of cattle, horses etc)
lit. lips/fig. glib talk
brains/mind/head/way of thinking
variant of 言辭|言辞[yan2 ci2]
to stir up trouble
to bother about/to haggle/to bicker/to argue/plan/stratagem
to fiddle with/to play and move sth about/to show off (what one can do)/to parade (one's capabilities)/to cause trouble
for no reason/gratuitously
to argue skillfully or plausibly/rhetoric
to gossip and meddle/to shoot one's mouth off/talkative
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to argue needlessly/to waste time explaining
to think sth through/to consider carefully
